summary: The ATP Agreement, or the Agreement on the International Carriage of Perishable Foodstuffs and on the Special Equipment to be Used for Such Carriage, is a pivotal legal framework within the EU's transport organization. It establishes standards for the safe and efficient transportation of perishable goods, ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations. By harmonizing practices across member states, the ATP Agreement facilitates international trade and enhances consumer protection. This regulatory instrument underscores the EU's commitment to maintaining high-quality transport services while promoting sustainability and efficiency in the logistics sector, thereby supporting the broader objectives of the internal market.
